titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Police Advisory Board, Yale University, Records
Police Advisory Board, Yale University, Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday November 30, 2018 at 11:19

did.unittitle: Police Advisory Board, Yale University, records

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The materials consist of correspondence, reports, agendas and meeting minutes of the Police Advisory Board.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 4-F (YRG 4-F), Records documenting Yale security.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The materials were transferred from the Office of the President, 1976; Office of of the Secretary, 1988.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the records is restricted. See Collection Contents for details.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright for materials authored or otherwise produced as official business of Yale University is retained by Yale University. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Police Advisory Board, Yale University, Records (RU 1102). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Yale University records are arranged and described at the accession level by the creating office. The University Archives creates collection level descriptive records, but typically does no further arrangement and description at the accession level.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials consist of correspondence, reports, agendas and meeting minutes of the Police Advisory Board.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged by accession.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The original inventory lists these records as "Campus Police History Project (JFF File)." JFF is probably Jonathan F. Fanton, Special Assistant to the President, who was a member of the Police Advisory Board. The records include crime reports, crime statistics, policies, correspondence, annual reports, arrests and incident reports concerning matters dealt with by the Police Advisory Board. Materials in these files are primarily addressed to Richard Carroll, Chair of Police Board, Henry Chauncey, Jr., Special Assistant to the President and Chair Police Board, and Jonathan Fanton.

did.unittitle: Report on security at University of Wisconsin
Thefts from colleges, Old Campus, and annexes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The bulk of the records appear to those of Lawrence Noble, Associate Secretary, who was an ex-officio member of the Police Advisory Board from 1973 to1981. Also includes records of Jonathan Fanton, Special Assistant to the President, who was a member of the Police Advisory Board. The records consist of reports, correspondence, agendas and meeting minutes of the Police Advisory Board, crime stats, and budgets. Reports, crime states, and budget materials seem to have been sent directly to the Secretary.

did.unittitle: City of New Haven Police Department
Survey of Other Police Departments, in Other Universities
Visits to and from Police Departments
